source.control.common¶

This module contains common control functions and classes.

Module Contents¶

Classes¶

PWM

Compute the duty ratio references and the realized voltage.

2DOF PI speed controller.

Rate limiter.

Datalogger for the control system.

source.control.common.state_machine(mdl, ctrl)[source]¶

State machine for running the simulation.

This runs the digital controller and calls the solver for integrating the continuous-time system model.

Parameters

  • mdl (object) – System model.

  • ctrl (object) – Controller.

source.control.common.duty_ratios(u, u_dc)[source]¶

Compute the duty ratios for three-phase PWM.

This compuates the duty ratios for three-phase PWM using a symmetrical suboscillation method. This method is identical to the standard space-vector PWM.

Parameters

  • u (complex) – Voltage space vector (typically reference value).

  • u_dc (float) – DC-bus voltage (typically measured value).

Returns

d_abc – Duty ratios (typically reference values).

Return type

ndarray, shape (3,)

class source.control.common.PWM(pars)[source]¶

Compute the duty ratio references and the realized voltage.

This contains the compuation of the duty ratio references and the realized voltage. The compuation of the realized voltage takes the digital delay effects into account.

Parameters

pars (data object) – Controller parameters.

__call__(self, u_ref, u_dc, theta, w)[source]¶

Compute the duty ratio references and update the state.

Parameters

  • u_ref (complex) – Voltage reference in synchronous coordinates.

  • u_dc (float) – DC-bus voltage.

  • theta (float) – Angle of synchronous coordinates.

  • w (float) – Angular frequency of synchronous coordinates.

Returns

d_abc_ref – Duty ratio references.

Return type

ndarray, shape (3,)

output(self, u_ref, u_dc, theta, w)[source]¶

Compute the duty ratio references and the limited voltage reference.

update(self, u_ref_lim)[source]¶

Update the voltage estimate for the next sampling instant.

Parameters

u_ref_lim (complex) – Limited voltage reference in synchronous coordinates.

class source.control.common.SpeedCtrl(pars)[source]¶

2DOF PI speed controller.

This speed controller is implemented using the disturbance-observer structure. The controller is mathematically identical to the 2DOF PI speed controller.

Parameters

pars (data object) – Controller parameters.

output(self, w_M_ref, w_M)[source]¶

Compute the torque reference and the load torque estimate.

Parameters

  • w_M_ref (float) – Rotor speed reference (in mechanical rad/s).

  • w_M (float) – Rotor speed (in mechanical rad/s).

Returns

  • tau_M_ref (float) – Torque reference.

  • tau_L (float) – Load torque estimate.

update(self, tau_M, tau_L)[source]¶

Update the integral state.

Parameters

  • tau_M (float) – Realized (limited) torque reference.

  • tau_L (float) – Load torque estimate.

__str__(self)[source]¶

Return str(self).

class source.control.common.RateLimiter(pars)[source]¶

Rate limiter.

Parameters

pars (data object) – Controller parameters.

__call__(self, u)[source]¶
Parameters

u (float) – Input signal.

Returns

y – Rate-limited output signal.

Return type

float

Notes

In this implementation, the falling rate limit equals the (negative) rising rate limit. If needed, these limits can be separated with minor modifications in the class.
